weather_report:
Just past midnight in Subiaco, the night feels rinsed and metallic, the kind of quiet that carries the scent of wet pavement before the first drops fall. Light rain is expected to wander through toward the small hours and into early morning, softening the edges of streetlights and leaving windows pearled. Skies look stubbornly overcast, so there’s little chance of sun early; clarity will be subdued, with distant shapes smudged by drizzle. UV will be negligible until after sunrise, and if the cloud holds, likely modest through the morning.

Plan for a muted, damp start: a light waterproof or compact umbrella, layers you can peel back, and shoes that don’t mind puddles. It won’t be unpleasant so much as hushed—good weather for small, methodical tasks and gentle routines. Now is a fine time to set tomorrow’s bag by the door, soak oats, or line up a playlist for the commute; if you’re awake, a short, hooded stroll under awnings can be quietly restorative. In the morning, expect slick roads and soft light; duck between showers for errands, or keep work close to home and let the day unfold in its grey-blue tempo. If the clouds fracture later, take brief advantage of any pale sun, but don’t count on it.
